entry.title: Open Inheritance Art project reveals 36,000 rarely seen private heritage artworks you can visit
entry.summary: Today, (16 February 2017) the [Open Inheritance Art](http://openiart.uk/) project, funded by the [Open Data Institute (ODI) Showcase](http://theodi.org/news/odi-showcase-winners-announced-for-our-summer-call), invites the public to discover and visit private collections of Britain’s most important cultural heritage artworks in a bid to increase access to art.

entry.title: Open Data Certificate: revamped to boost data publishing standards around the world
entry.summary: Open Data Certificate achieves over 150,000 published certificates, introduces an auto-certification process and revamps badge levels to encourage publishing standards worldwide

entry.title: Travel smarter with open data app Fasteroute
entry.summary: Research from open data startup [Fasteroute](http://fasteroute.com) and the [Open Data Institute](http://theodi.org) (ODI) reveals the UK cities most affected by morning delays and how commuters can avoid them

entry.title: ODI features in full force at Big Bang Data art exhibition
entry.summary: The ODI affirms its commitment to data and the arts, showcasing artworks, thought-leadership and training at the heart of London’s cultural scene

entry.title: ODI: Over £40m* value unlocked worldwide
entry.summary: The Open Data Institute (ODI) has announced that the total value it has helped unlock to the open data ecosystem [has exceeded £40m](http://dashboards.theodi.org/company/all) in the three years since it opened.

entry.title: Community sensors indicate high air pollution in Heathrow neighbourhoods
entry.summary: Startup OpenSensors.io calls for a democratisation of air quality data as project identifies Heathrow pollution exceeds EU limits

entry.title: ODI Data as Culture programme opens residency call with Sound and Music
entry.summary: ODI Data as Culture and Sound and Music open calls for sound artist residency

entry.title: The Open Data Institute appoints new artist in residence Natasha Caruana
entry.summary: The Open Data Institute appoints new artist in residence Natasha Caruana and hosts UK premiere of ‘At First Sight’ work

entry.title: Celebrating Generation Open – ODI awards network thinkers who are changing the world
